snippet: The economic recovery has not revived population growth in the formerly booming exurbs.
abstract: Census bureau offers the first detailed picture of population shift in the United States since the end of the recession; data shows that population growth in outer suburbs, the fastest growing areas in the last decade, all but ground to a halt in 2010 and 2011, as the painful effects of the housing crisis lingered.
lead_paragraph: The economic recovery has not revived population growth in the formerly booming exurbs.

headline.seo: Census Data Shows Recession’s Toll on Outer Suburbs
headline.main: Census Data Offers Look at Effects of Recession
headline.print_headline: Census Data Offers Look At Effects Of Recession
